title: Test Post
text:
library(palmerpenguins)
library(tidyverse)
ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = bill_length_mm)) + geom_histogram(color = "black", fill = "white")

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Are Drone strikes More Deadly?
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(here)

here() starts at /Users/goparop/Documents/R-Projects/Data.Visual.Blog

airstrikes <- read_csv(here("data/DroneWarsData.csv"))

New names:
Rows: 573 Columns: 36
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(30): Strike ID, Country, Date (MM-DD-YYYY), President, Village/local ar... dbl
(6): Reportedly drone?, US confirmed?, US only source?, Minimum strikes...
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...14`
• `` -> `...15`



library(lubridate)
# airstrikes tidy
airstrikes_tidy <- as_tibble(airstrikes) |>
  mutate(Date = mdy(`Date (MM-DD-YYYY)`)) |>
  select(!`Date (MM-DD-YYYY)`) |>
  relocate(Date)
